t: Amazon Effect - Wikipedia
s: October 3, 2024 - The disruptive effect of e-commerce on the global retail industry has been referred to as the Amazon Effect: the term refers to Amazon.com's dominant role in the e-commerce market place and its leading role in driving the disruptive impact on the retail market and its supply chain.

t: As Competitors Struggle, Inflation Helps Put Amazon Back On Top

t: US consumers, brands, sellers on Amazon worried about inflation: Study - Fibre2Fashion
s: Cost is the strongest factor driving purchase decisions on Amazon, where more than half of US consumers start online product searches, a Q1 2024 US survey found. Consumers aren't the only ones worried about inflation; over a quarter of brands and sellers on Amazon are also worried.

t: How inflation has impacted your Amazon cart
s: December 14, 2022 - Inflation has also made menstrual products more expensive. These price hikes are also compounded by the fact that some states do not exempt menstrual products from sales tax—and do not allow them to be paid for with food stamps or other welfare program benefits. t: 'Amazon effect' could have impact on inflation dynamics: paper | Reuters
s: August 25, 2018 - More frequent price changes for goods and a rise in the consistency of pricing due to the growth of online retailers may be affecting inflation, according to an academic paper presented on Saturday to some of the world's top central bankers.
